results.name: wordpress-namespace/mysql-85579f9644-gz8xr
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "mysql:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check Kubernetes node permissions.
5. Try a specific version tag instead of "latest".

results.name: wordpress-namespace/wordpress-fb6795cb7-kcnhg

error.Text: failed to pull and unpack image "docker.io/library/wordpress:latest": failed to copy: httpReadSeeker: failed open: unexpected status code https://registry-1.docker.io/v2/library/wordpress/manifests/sha256:79dd7ea093b253ebbfd49869222534108c90c1e06b7074250e07514a6a0d1454: 429 Too Many Requests - Server message: toomanyrequests: You have reached your pull rate limit. You may increase the limit by authenticating and upgrading: https://www.docker.com/increase-rate-limit

results.details:
Error: The error indicates that the Docker image pull request was denied due to exceeding the rate limit for unauthenticated users.

Solution: 
1. Create a Docker account.
2. Log in using `docker login` on your system.
3. Update your Kubernetes imagePullSecrets with your Docker credentials.

results.name: wordpress-namespace/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-85579f9644-gz8xr], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the specified pod is not ready.  
Solution: 1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`. 2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs mysql-85579f9644-gz8xr`. 3. Verify readiness probe configuration. 4. Ensure all dependencies are running. 5. Restart pod if necessary.

results.name: wordpress-namespace/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-fb6795cb7-kcnhg], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the specified pod is not in a ready state.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs wordpress-fb6795cb7-kcnhg`.
3. Verify readiness probe configuration.
4. Ensure the pod's containers are running correctly.
